channel.title: Eprom on Steckschwein
channel.description: Recent content in Eprom on Steckschwein

item.title: Flash - Master of the Universe
item.description: The 28C256 EEPROM, which holds the BIOS, has been our go-to choice since the early breadboard days. Before that, we relied on EPROMs, which required UV erasure before every upgradeâ€”a time-consuming and inconvenient process. Switching to an EEPROM significantly improved our workflow, reducing turnaround time. However, the 28C256 has a couple of drawbacks: It cannot be written in-circuit since it requires a 12V programming voltage, which the Steckschwein does not provide.
